title: Looking to Eat Less Meat? This Winter Salad Recipe Makes a Hearty Meal; Potatoes, apples, fresh herbs and a punchy mustard vinaigrette adds up to a highly satisfying salad. Add a little prosciutto and Parmesan—or don't, and keep it vegan.
text:
The Chef: Anne Quatrano

PHOTO: Michael Hoeweler

Her Restaurants: Bacchanalia, Floataway Café, Star Provisions Market and Café, W.H. Stiles Fish Camp, all in Atlanta

What She's Known For: Lifting up Atlanta's food scene with elegant farm-to-table dishes for over 25 years. Timeless ingredient-focused cooking and smart moves that reveal the chef's individual style.

AFTER FEEDING GUESTS in her Atlanta restaurants for nearly three decades, chef Anne Quatrano knows their appetites, and the way they shift with the seasons. "In the New Year people are thinking about eating less meat and more vegetables," she said. "This recipe is perfect for that." Just a few thin slices of prosciutto give this warm potato salad a rich flavor and feel. Fresh herbs, tart apple slices, curls of Parmesan and a mustard-shallot vinaigrette round out this comforting meal and give it an invigorating punch.

Waxy fingerling potatoes hold their shape and their satisfying texture once they've boiled, and you'll want to get them into that mustardy vinaigrette right away after cooking. "I peel each one by hand and then slice it directly into the dressing," Ms. Quatrano said. "Potatoes are so porous. They need to be seasoned while they're hot." The potatoes should be quite dry before you dress them, too, for maximum absorption. Toss the apple slices in lemon juice to prevent browning, and add them just before serving to preserve their snap.

As always, a little prosciutto goes a long way. If you want to omit it altogether, this makes a great vegetarian recipe, too. The same goes for the cheese, if you'd like to make this recipe vegan. "It's adaptable," Ms. Quatrano said. "We've been serving this for 20 years."

—Kitty Greenwald is a chef, food writer and the co-author of 'Slow Fires' (Clarkson Potter)
